bug.short_desc: qx.ui.mobile.form.TextField can only work on ipad 1 with qx.mobile.nativescroll set to false

long_desc.thetext:
On Apple iPad 1, qx.ui.mobile.form.TextField only can bring up the soft keyboard with qx.mobile.nativescroll set to false. Is it a bug or just a restriction from the device?
This can be easily verified by creating a mobile app from skeleton and simply adding a new textfield into the page1.

We do not have an iPad 1 for testing. So it is difficult for us to verify this.
Which iOS version do you use? Depending on the iOS version the NativeScroll might not work. NativeScroll only works on iOS 5+
We tested the NativeScroll on iPad 2 and iPad3, also on iPhone 4 and 5.
It would say that this is a device restriction. If you want to support iOS version below 5, you may keep NativeScroll to false.
The behavior of iScroll and NativeScroll is very similar. The NativeScroll provides a little better performance than the iScroll.
Hi Christopher, thanks for your comment. My iPad 1 runs IOS v5.1.1 which is the latest as well as last system available to the first generation.
